title: Engie readies co-investor search for Aus renewables portfolio
text:
French energy company Engie is seeking a new co-investor to take debt and equity stakes in its Australian renewable energy assets.

Street Talk understands Engie, which operates in Australia as the major shareholder in a joint venture with Japanese trading house Mitsui, will offer a stake in its existing assets as well as future wind farm and other renewable projects.

Paul Maguire, CEO of Engie Asia Pacific and Augustin Honorat, group CEO, at the opening of Willogoleche Wind Farm in July. Michalis Philippou

It is understood Engie has asked a handful of investment banks to pitch for the sale mandate and will have the chosen bank contact potential investors in coming months.

Sources said Engie was hoping to create an "equity platform" which would allow it to access new forms of debt and equity funding and grow its Australian portfolio. Engie is expected to pitch it as a growth story, enabling it to build and own more renewables projects.

The sale would also enable the company to sell existing investments, which include the $250 million Willogoleche Wind Farm in South Australia that was officially opened earlier this year. It is owned in partnership with Mitsui.
description: French energy company Engie is seeking a new co-investor for its Australian renewable energy assets.
